channel.title: Ring of wealth new drop tables?
channel.description:
I was fighting moss giants and an uncut dragon stone dropped anyone else get strange drops with the new ring of wealth?
[IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/2zs41ol.png[/img]

item.title: Ring of wealth new drop tables?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:47, topic:386499”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=482257.msg3535460#msg3535460 date=1300533926]
But yer, friend got vecna skull + 97 torstol seeds from steel dragon task on first day, i’m pretty sure that was just insane luck. He sold skull for 18m and torstol seeds for 38m (he quadrupled his bank in a day).
[/quote]I’ve heard quite a few stories of things like that… prepare for herb and seed crashes![/quote]I honestly don’t think so. Some people may be lucky enough to get a few drops fast, but its really not all too likely. I’m training at Fire Giants and have been at metal dragons earlier today and had no luck.

Read full topic

item.title: Ring of wealth new drop tables?
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Fuse, post:36, topic:386499”][quote author=Rich link=topic=482257.msg3534452#msg3534452 date=1300464762]

RuneScape Wiki

Rare drop table

The rare drop table is a special list of items. When slain, some monsters have a chance to give loot from the rare drop table in addition to loot from their own unique drop table. Unlike the standard drop table, the rare drop table is shared by many...


[/quote]
Wtf, am I not getting something here? I don’t get it…[/quote]

These are drops are almost only gained when wearing the ring of wealth. Without one, the chance to get them is a lot rarer. A lot of monsters in the rare drop table list also give access to this list.

I see

Coal Coal 5952–7493 (noted)

and

Clean torstol 50–98 (noted)

well to cut a long story short, I shat brix

Read full topic

item.source: Ring of wealth new drop tables?

item.title: Ring of wealth new drop tables?
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

On 15 March, 2011, the day the ring of wealth was updated, a major bug caused the effect of the updated ring to stack when multiple players in a clan used lootshare. This caused the Corporeal Beast, as well as many other bosses regularly hunted by clans, to generate “significantly more generous drops than usual”, including multiple Sigils and other otherwise very rare items at a near 100% frequency. This bug was patched within 90 minutes of its release. Jagex later issued a statement of apology and revealed that there would be no rollbacks. Many players continued to take to the forums and demand rollbacks to fix the market prices. Some worlds, like 66, held vast riots in response to Jagex’s decision to do nothing to reconcile this incident.

Read full topic

Behind the Scenes - March

Hold onto your Robin Hood hats, good people of RuneScape: March is going to be bigger than a big thing on a big day viewed through a very big sextant! With zombie pirates a-plenty, the opening of Dorgesh-Kaan and a whole host of new things to do,...

And i just noticed its actually the new update

RuneScape

Ring of Wealth, Shanties, Trolls and Dungeoneering

We�ve got a bumper pack of updates this week including making the ring of wealth more useful, shanties recounting your previous piratical adventures, new-look trolls roaming around their renovated home of Trollheim, and a raft of gameplay...

Hmm maybe now i might actually get a chance at a visage
And maybe barrows, because it helps that

item.source: Ring of wealth new drop tables?

item.title: Ring of wealth new drop tables?
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Ring of Wealth

The ring of wealth has been a kind of lucky charm for RuneScape players for many years now – even though its effects were limited, and the wealth it brought was of dubious value, many still chose to wear it for good luck. We have now improved it so that it will better increase your chances of receiving rare items from drops or clue scrolls, occasionally improve some common drops, and give you bonus items in a few specific pieces of content. What’s more, the ring will now also let you know when it has made a difference to your drops, so you can better judge how useful wearing one is for how you play.

More specifically, wearing a ring of wealth will slightly increase the drop chances of many rare items obtained from Slayer monsters and various bosses, as well as all clue scrolls. The ring will also increase your chances of getting better rewards and more items from various activities, including looting the Barrows chest, Pyramid Plunder (including sceptres and new ‘jewelled statuette’ loot), taking out Bork (guaranteed improvement to his drops), catching kingly implings, and further improving your chances of receiving gems while mining (if also wearing a charged amulet of glory).

Additionally, we have added two teleport destinations to the ring: the Grand Exchange and, if you have finished the Throne of Miscellania quest, to Miscellania too. Rings of wealth can be recharged in the same ways as amulets of glory.

Mod Piesche
RuneScape QA


RuneScape

Ring of Wealth, Shanties, Trolls and Dungeoneering

We�ve got a bumper pack of updates this week including making the ring of wealth more useful, shanties recounting your previous piratical adventures, new-look trolls roaming around their renovated home of Trollheim, and a raft of gameplay...

I think that about sums this up.

Read full topic
